item.title: 情報筋の話リバティ・グローバルとWBDは、英国最大のインディーズTV制作会社である合弁会社All3Mediaの株式（総額1億ポンド相当）の売却を検討している（Amy-Jo Crowley/Reuters）。
item.description:
Amy-Jo Crowley / Reuters:
Sources: Liberty Global and WBD are considering selling their stakes, worth £1B total, in joint venture All3Media, the UK's largest indie TV production company  —  The owners of All3Media (ALLMD.UL), Britain's largest independent TV production company, are exploring options …

item.title: 虐待を受けた子どもの画像を元にしたAIディープフェイクが自らの悲惨な末路を描く、AI真犯人被害者TikTokのグロテスクな世界を見てみよう（EJ Dickson/Rolling Stone）
item.description:
EJ Dickson / Rolling Stone:
A look at the grotesque world of AI true-crime-victim TikTok, where AI deepfakes, based on images of children who were abused, describe their own ghastly demise  —  TikTok accounts are posting horrifying artificial intelligence-generated clips of murder victims — mostly children — describing their own ghastly demise

item.title: ITV、若年労働者との関係について嘘を認めた司会者フィリップ・スコフィールドの辞職について外部審査を委託（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
ITV commissions an external review of presenter Phillip Schofield's resignation after he admitted to lying about a relationship with a young worker  —  British broadcaster ITV (ITV.L) has commissioned an external review of presenter Phillip Schofield's resignation, the company said on Wednesday …

item.title: オーストラリア兵のベン・ロバーツ＝スミスが、アフガニスタンで戦争犯罪を犯したと訴えられた名誉毀損裁判で、The Age、SMH、Canberra Timesに敗訴した（Ben Doherty/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Ben Doherty / The Guardian:
Australian soldier Ben Roberts-Smith loses a defamation case in which he was accused of committing war crimes in Afghanistan by The Age, SMH, and Canberra Times  —  Justice Anthony Besanko found newspapers established substantial or contextual truth of allegations of murders of unarmed civilians in Afghanistan

item.title: ウィスコンシン州のスペイン語を話す酪農家労働者への取材方法（QRコードから音声版への誘導も含む）（ProPublica
item.description:
ProPublica:
How reporters for ProPublica reached Spanish-speaking dairy farm workers in Wisconsin, including via QR codes that take people to the audio version of the story  —  As we reported on dairy farms in Wisconsin, we knew we'd have to get creative in how we got our articles to the affected workers.

item.title: ディズニーは、全世界の総人員22万人の3.2%にあたる7000人のレイオフという目標を達成した。ソース：時間をかけて国際的にさらなる削減が予定されている（Jennifer Maas/Variety）
item.description:
Jennifer Maas / Variety:
Disney has reached its target of 7,000 layoffs, or 3.2% of its total global headcount of 220,000; source: more cuts are planned internationally over time  —  Disney reached its 7,000 layoffs goal, handing out notices to the remaining employees impacted in its third round of job cuts …

item.title: Project VeritasがJames O'Keefeを提訴、覆面カメラ組織を離れライバル組織を立ち上げたため雇用契約の一部を破ったと主張（Will Sommer/Washington Post)
item.description:
Will Sommer / Washington Post:
Project Veritas sues James O'Keefe, claiming he broke parts of his employment contract as he left the undercover-camera outfit and set up a rival operation  —  The right-wing group, known for its undercover videos, also alleges its former chairman lavished donor money on his own expenses

item.title: Baltimore BannerのCEO Imtiaz Patelは7月7日に退任し、Gannettのシニアリーダーシップに参加する予定。
item.description:
Liz Bowie / The Baltimore Banner:
Baltimore Banner CEO Imtiaz Patel plans to step down on July 7 to join Gannett's senior leadership; Brian McGrory will lead the nonprofit during its CEO search  —  Our nonprofit news organization is made possible by subscribers and donors who value storytelling that impacts and uplifts communities.

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズの複数のジャーナリストは、セラノスの創業者エリザベス・ホームズのソフトフォーカスなプロフィールを掲載したことに懸念を抱き、失望していると述べている（Charlotte Klein/Vanity Fair）。
item.description:
Charlotte Klein / Vanity Fair:
Multiple New York Times journalists say they remain concerned and disappointed the outlet published a soft-focus profile of Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes  —  As Holmes headed to jail Tuesday, business editor Ellen Pollock was put on the spot to defend a soft-focus profile …

item.title: オーディオ・ストーリーテリングに関するジャーナリズムと文化批評をミックスした特集を目指す年2回の新しい印刷雑誌「Good Tape」の共同創設者とのQ&A（Amrita Khalid/The Verge）
item.description:
Amrita Khalid / The Verge:
Q&A with the co-founders of Good Tape, a new biannual print magazine that aims to feature a mix of journalism and cultural criticism about audio storytelling  —  This is Hot Pod, The Verge's newsletter about podcasting and the audio industry. … Hope everyone is well rested after the holiday weekend.

item.title: WAN-IFRAが編集者、ジャーナリストなどニュースルームのスタッフ101人を対象に実施した調査：~ニュースルームが生成AIに積極的に取り組んでいると答えたのは49%で、そのほとんどがテキスト作成です（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
WAN-IFRA survey of 101 editors, journalists, and other newsroom staff: ~49% say their newsroom is actively working with generative AI, mostly for text creation  —  The WAN-IFRA survey indicated it is management, rather than individual journalists, driving adoption.

item.title: Quartzの共同設立者であり、同誌でCEO、記者、編集者、編集長を歴任したザック・スワード氏が、6月9日に退社すると発表した（Zach Seward/ZMS）
item.description:
Zach Seward / ZMS:
Quartz co-founder Zach Seward, who has served at the publication as CEO, reporter, editor, and editor-in-chief, says he is leaving the company on June 9  —  I'm stepping down from Quartz after more than 11 years as, variously, co-founder, reporter, editor, chief product officer, CEO, owner and, most recently, editor-in-chief.

item.title: メタは、州政府がテック企業に出版社への支払いを強制する法律案を可決した場合、カリフォルニア州のプラットフォームからニュースコンテンツを削除すると脅した（Katie Paul/Reuters）
item.description:
Katie Paul / Reuters:
Meta threatens to remove news content from its platforms in California if the state government passes a proposed law forcing tech companies to pay publishers  —  Facebook parent Meta Platforms (META.O) said on Wednesday it would remove news content in its home state of California …

item.title: OPEC、今週末のウィーン会合からロイター、ブルームバーグ、ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナルを締め出す、情報筋：サウジアラビアのエネルギー相がこの決定を促した（Financial Times)
item.description:
Financial Times:
OPEC bars Reuters, Bloomberg, and The Wall Street Journal from its Vienna meeting this weekend; sources: Saudi Arabia's energy minister instigated the decision  —  Reuters, Bloomberg and Dow Jones denied invites in decision driven by Saudi Arabia's energy minister

item.title: ニュージャージー州の中国系コミュニティの定番となっている、1.25ドル/号で6人のフルタイムスタッフを抱える中国語雑誌「Sino Monthly」を見てみる（Mary Yang/NPR）
item.description:
Mary Yang / NPR:
A look at Sino Monthly, a Chinese-language magazine with six full-time staff that costs $1.25/issue and has become a staple for New Jersey's Chinese community  —  EDISON, N.J. - Bundles of free newspapers are stacked by the doors of Chinese supermarkets in New Jersey.
